title: CA suspends Puttalam High Court Judge’s order to jail lady lawyer
byline: In a swift response to an urgent appeal, the Court of Appeal today issued an interim order suspending the decision made by the Puttalam High Court Judge to remand a lady lawyer over an alleged contemptuous conduct.

title: Deaths from devastating earthquake in Myanmar climb past 1,700
byline: The death toll from the earthquake that hit Myanmar has risen to more than 1,700 as more bodies have been pulled from the rubble, the country’s military-led government said Monday.

title: Person found dead at luxury hotel in Colombo
byline: Police have launched an investigation after an individual was found dead at a luxury hotel near Galle Face Green.

title: Shammi Silva re-elected as SLC President
byline: Shammi Silva has been re-elected as the President of Sri Lanka Cricket for the 2025–2027 term.

title: HIV cases hit record high in Sri Lanka
byline: Sri Lanka has experienced a significant surge in HIV/AIDS cases in 2024 recording over 800 cases.

title: Colombo’s skyscrapers are built to withstand earthquakes – Seismologist
byline: Although Sri Lanka is not typically considered a high-seismic zone, the mushrooming skyscrapers in Colombo are safe from any unexpected earthquake, as they are built using such structural technology, a seismologist said.

title: Construction activity in Sri Lanka continues to expand in February
byline: Sri Lanka’s construction sector continued to expand in February, with increased construction activity reported by most respondents, according to the Central Bank.

title: UK sanctions: Sarath Fonseka defends Shavendra Silva
byline: Referring to the recent sanctions imposed by the United Kingdom on top Sri Lankan military officials, Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka, who played a significant role in the country’s civil war, stated that the sanction against former Army Commander Shavendra Silva was unreasonable.

title: Organized criminal ‘Rotumba Amila’ arrested in Russia
byline: Organized criminal Amila Sampath, alias ‘Rotumba Amila’, has been arrested in Russia.

title: Royal Madras Yacht Club launches first Chennai-Sri Lanka sailing expedition
byline: The Royal Madras Yacht Club, together with IndSri Ferry Services Lanka Pvt Ltd, today launched the first international sailing expedition from Chennai to Sri Lanka, lasting seven days.

title: Youth found dead at luxury hotel in Colombo
byline: Police have launched an investigation after an individual was found dead at a luxury hotel near Galle Face Green.

title: KDU hospital a burden to Treasury, Govt committee identifies
byline: Sir John Kotelawala Defence University Hospital which is commonly known as the KDU hospital has been identified as a burden to the Treasury because it does not generate profits, according to a top level committee.

title: Fuel prices to be revised from tonight
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation has announced a revision of fuel prices, effective from midnight today (31).

title: Laugfs increases LP gas prices
byline: The price of 12.5kg domestic Laugfs Gas cylinders has been increased by Rs.420 with effect from today.

title: Search for quake survivors intensifies in Myanmar, Thailand; death toll expected to rise 2,000
byline: Survivors were pulled out of rubble in Myanmar and signs of life were detected in the ruins of a skyscraper in Bangkok on Monday as efforts intensified to find people trapped three days after a massive earthquake in Southeast Asia that killed around 2,000.

title: PM visits France for high-level conference at UNESCO
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, is on an official visit to Paris, France, to participate in the high-level segment of the International Expert Conference on An Integrated and Sustainable Approach to Safeguarding the World Heritage Property of the Sacred City of Anuradhapura in Sri Lanka and Associated Living Heritage.

title: Price of a cup of tea to increase by Rs. 10 from tonight: Canteen Owners
byline: The All Island Canteen Owners’ Association (AICOA) has decided to increase the price of a cup of tea by Rs. 10 from tonight.

title: Station Masters to refrain from duties from tonight
byline: The Sri Lanka Railways Station Masters’ Union (SLRSMU) has decided to refrain from all duties at sub-train stations in the Colombo region starting tonight.

title: Weligama shooting incident: Tiran Alles leaves CID after five-hour statement
byline: Former Public Security Minister Tiran Alles left the Criminal Investigations Department (CID) after a five and a half hours statement was recorded.

title: Namal calls on AKD to question Shani, Ravi Seneviratne over Easter attacks
byline: While alleging that Shani Abeysekera, and Ravi Seneviratne have used political asylum by holding key positions in the government to avoid prosecution regarding the Easter Sunday attacks, SLPP MP Namal Rajapaksa called on the President to question them.

title: Govt focuses on developing Jaffna International Airport
byline: The government has paid special attention to enhancing facilities and undertaking development activities at the Jaffna International Airport (JIA), also known as Palali Airport.
